u.doc: The URL of the page to share.

url.doc: The URL of the page to share. This value should be url encoded.

hl.doc: The language code for the locale to use on the Google+ sharing page (see https://developers.google.com/+/web/share/#available-languages).

url.doc: A fully-qualified HTTP or HTTPS-based URL, URL-encoded. The provided URL will be shortened with t.co and appended to the end of the Tweet.

via.doc: A screen name to associate with the Tweet. The provided screen name will be appended to the end of the tweet with the text: "via @username" "Via" will be translated to the proper locality of the posting user, if supported. Potentially drives new followers to the target account.

text.doc: Pre-prepared, properly UTF-8 & percent-encoded Tweet body text. Users will still be able to edit the pre-prepared text. This field has a potential of 140 characters maximum, but consider the implications of other parameters like url and via.

in_reply_to.doc: Associate this Tweet with a specific Tweet by indicating its status ID here. The originating Tweet Author's screen name will be automatically prepended to the reply.

hashtags.doc: Add context to the pre-prepared status update by appending #hashtags.

related.doc: Suggest accounts related to the your content or intention by comma-separating a list of screen names.
